author: uptodatedevelopers
title: CARDANO FRENCH COMMUNITY IN DRC
description: Projects developed in French-speaking African countries lack information on blockchain technology in general.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea is very good and serves the challenge’s objectives well, which are to promote projects that benefit both the African continent and Cardano’s blockchain. In the present case, online meetings would be developed between developers who speak French and come from Africa, this would certainly benefit the continent, as it would provide education for professionals in the field of technology, opening the door for them to work in one of the various opportunities. jobs present in the Cardano ecosystem (which can be found, for example, in Catalyst itself); this would give them more preparation for them to become future proponents, if they wish, build Dapps, in short, this will allow them to work with a company and a technology that is growing and popular, which will generate many opportunities for a stable income in the future. And for sure the project will also be great for our blockchain, for two basic reasons. First, because it will prepare new professionals to work on our projects, and manpower is something that is sometimes still lacking here, from what I understand, especially in specific tasks, such as programming in Plutus, for example. And, in addition to generating a skilled workforce, this series of classes (so to speak) would popularize the Cardano ecosystem for a community that, as the proponents themselves say, is often excluded, French speakers in Africa. It is very positive as the proponents already have a defined destination for where they will start this project - Congo - this gives us a more solid view of what is to come. It is also positive that they will record the meetings and post them on youtube, because the internet connection can often be a problem for those involved here, so that would not be an impediment for them to participate in the project. Another positive point is that they already have a base, a telegram community with more than 130 developers, if everyone fits the characteristics highlighted here, that is, whether they are Africans and French speakers, there is already a very considerable amount of people to participate. from the project. However, I think some important details were left out, such as: what content would be covered in these meetings, in what order, with what strategy they would be passed on, what amount of meetings are expected, what amount of developers is expected for each meeting, if after the conclusion of these meetings there would be some way to follow the development of the professionals involved... Finally, details, which, if provided, would certainly add even more value to the impact of this idea.
f6_assessments.q1: The feasibility of the project is ok, but it can improve in some aspects. Let's start with the script, there are some tasks that would need to be fulfilled, such as “reconstitution of the English classes in French in pdf, powerpoint” and “creation of a small promotional video for the invitation to participate”. We also know what general issues would be addressed in each month of the project. However, the script could have been better organized. The activities that would take place monthly could be divided, and each one of them is very detailed. For example, in the first month, the focus would be to take these classes in pdf/powerpoint, right? How long would it take to prepare each class? Who would work on it? What is the approximate size of these classes? As the proponents explain to us the areas to be studied each month, the theme of each class should also be defined individually. For example, in “June 2022: Introduction to Cardano, Blockchain and Smart Contracts”. This topic is quite extensive, how many meetings would take place this month? And what specific topic of each, within this universe of introduction to Cardano and etc? In other words, the script is still a bit messy, in my opinion, because we know what would happen, but not when, how or who would carry out each activity. Regarding the budget, I believe the asking amount of 9k USD is very fair, and would be money very well invested. However, I would like it to be better explained, its explanation is quite superficial. 3k would go for content creation in French and creation of a promotional video, would the content be the classes in pdf/powerpoint? How many would be created, to understand their individual value? Who would receive this money? The rest would go to video editing and pay the trainers. How much would go to editing, and how much to the coaches' salary? How many hours would these coaches work, what would be the value of their working hour? And in relation to the team, I think this part is very good, they are apparently very qualified people and very involved with Cardano, in addition to a small CV of each, the proponents attach their linkedin profiles, of how we can have concrete proof about what is said. However, I think it would be even more interesting if the roles of each of these members in the project were defined, we don't know who would do what. But that's all that remains pending, otherwise, I think this part of the proposal is very good. Therefore, my suggestions for feasibility here are: improving the script, establishing greater detail and a more detailed time division; explain better how the money would be used and define the tasks of each team professional in the project.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditability here is above average. Proponents are concerned with outlining ways to monitor both the project development process and the final results. I think some improvements can be made, but let's go in parts. Regarding the monitoring of the project, this could happen by checking the videos posted on youtube, which would correspond to the weekly meetings; from what I understand these moments (or the contents taught?) would also be available in text form on another site. This already gives us good content to be audited, we have material to analyze in relation to the progress of the project. It would be even better, though, if the team's professionals could provide some input regarding how the developers who are participating in the meetings are responding to the events; how many are going to each session; if there is a good interaction during this synchronous moment; if they are having difficulty learning about a topic; in short: to understand how these meetings are going, not only if they are happening. I think that, since they have already opened a communication channel through the website https://uptodatedevelopers.com/our-trainings, a small analysis of each meeting could be posted there, I don't think that video meetings are necessary, for example, if that platform is already being used. Perhaps the follow-up and engagement questionnaire, cited in the key indicators, is exactly what I am suggesting; in this case, I consider that the auditability of the process is perfect. And speaking of the final results, the proponents choose good indicators to see if the project would be having the intended impacts, such as the number of participants per session; whether they would come out prepared to develop a Dapp, for example; whether the Congolese developers would be effectively using this “gateway” that is being offered to them and so on. I only had one question: how would the project team collect and disseminate such information? Would it be through the same website as the project's progress? I would like to understand this, in order to have complete confidence in the question of whether the final results will be well audited. I think the best way is to contact the developers directly and apply a quick questionnaire, asking things like if they are participating in a project at Cardano and so on. So I think the auditability here is almost perfect, with few things to improve.

f6_assessments.q0: Increasing the understanding of Cardano in Africa is the aim behind the Grow Africa, Grow Cardano challenge and the proposal has been well developed to achieve that. English is the most widely spoken languages in Cardano community but if Africa is the target then the variety of languages spoken in Africa would be a problem. This proposal seems to provide a solution out of that by getting a community for the francophone areas so there is a wider reception and understanding of the Cardano system beginning with DR Congo. This would also create the suitable environment for engineers in Africa to welcome blockchain technology in larger numbers. This proposal  has been written well and it suits the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer presents a competent team in seeing to the completion of the project. The Budget has also been well broken down and is is reasonable enough to c omplete the goal. The timeline drawn is well reasonable and feasible for the period given. The proposer also considers the challenges and the risks relevant to the success of the task
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer does not state what the end results would look like but shows the how it would be monitored. I would like for the proposer to give more details as to their KPIs and not to indicate what they would do. Example, stating that they would use questionnaires to follow up and engage the participants does not tell us anything since that is what they would use but the results are what matter.

f6_assessments.q0: This project will be able to solve the problem of the lack of presence of a French speaking community on the Cardano exchange in Africa. They gave a pretty good solution, with a clear direction and implementation. Besides, they have also identified the risks that the project may have and come up with a good way to solve the problem. In addition, this project also has a good foundation, which means that they already know the background work and will focus more on the development of the project in the future.
f6_assessments.q1: First, you will see the timetable of the jobs clearly arranged, scientifically divided by month. Updating videos or lessons non-stop for 4 months will also create a habit for viewers that it is time for them to update information. This is a pretty cool solution. Next, for the 'a detailed budget breakdown' section, the funds have been split into 2 tranches, but the founder should add more details like how much the 'Creation of content in French' will cost in total $3000. Everything needs clarity. Finally, the information of project members has been updated quite well, updating linkedin will help voters be more active in learning about project information.
f6_assessments.q2: The fact that the founder has set goals is quite good. Besides, having a clear KPI also shows the founders' interest and research in the project. This is a plus point for the proposal. However, the founder should add numbers to prove the project's success, when looking at the proposal, voters can see it, which makes it easier for them to follow.

f6_assessments.q0: The project of developing a Cardano community for the exchange of information and knowledge is not new, but your project is attractive in that you give priority to the French community. And as a member of the francophones, I certainly appreciate your ideas. To reaffirm that your project ALIGNS with the challenge, I commend the goals you have set when you want to establish this community in DRC. You presented well how your team will reach French-speaking people in Africa, how you will help them learn about blockchain and how the project will facilitate African developers actively active in Cardano. Moreover, the risks you put out are close to reality, and the solutions are also reasonable. With the available capital from the developer community on telegram, I believe your team will realize this project very effectively. However, if you can provide more about your realistic vision or why you are motivated to build this project, I think the reader will understand your project better. And let's add a few names of experienced developers to help increase the level of confidence for investors.
f6_assessments.q1: With a project that doesn't require as much material and technical tools as yours, I think you've covered quite a bit of what you need to do in the future. A plan with such a precise timeline is also good, but this is still not enough to convince investors. When you haven't specified what you are going to do to accomplish these items and how you will do it with the allocation of resources. Furthermore, the detailed plan section is still pretty sketchy, and I wonder which two steps you mentioned here correspond to which timeline in your plan. And finally, please introduce more about your members, rather than their link and title. It won't take long to introduce, but it will help investors overview your team's capabilities. Please consider.
f6_assessments.q2: First, let's talk about how the community will track the progress of your project. You should not only show how to help the community track it but also explain what goals you want to have for the activities mentioned in the plan above and the estimated time to complete them. Second, I commend you for seeing what this project's success looks like and listing the key metrics you aspire to achieve. However, it's a pity that you can't give a more specific thing than the word "number". How many people do you want to attend the session? How many will new developers join? And how many questionnaires do you like to distribute and receive? Just quantitative numbers that will make your proposal a lot better.

f6_assessments.q0: Recognizing the lack of access to expertise of using French material, the proposer devised a strategy with comprehensive and concise information on each stage to address this challenge. The project will allow users to communicate directly with advisers to draw their own expertise by linking French professionals via Telegram. Furthermore, effective cooperation with social media aims to promote the Cardano ecosystem while also improving user experience. Plus, in order to understand the situation and handle difficulties in a timely way, the proposer suggests plausible alternatives for future challenges. Although it is a bit short, it is typically satisfactory. The major activity has been recognized; although, it is unclear who the target clients are, in general, the DCR. Those who are appropriate for this project should be specifically addressed, such as new enterprises searching for growth possibilities or students interested in learning about blockchain. Moreover, a viewpoint on the project's influence on those things must be expressed in order to determine whether it is appropriate.
f6_assessments.q1: The strategy is outlined according to each timeline from July to September, with specific goals in mind. The maneuvers are also quite clever and go well with the plan. Even the initial investment is inextricably tied to each of the stated processes. Members of the team are also almost famous in the software development sector. However, the lack of consultants from France or expertise in utilizing French is a mistake for the objective of teaching and passing French knowledge to the DCR. In order to create the most relevant and thorough material for consumers, the proposer should select more French professionals with experience working in DCR or Africa.
f6_assessments.q2: Numerous accomplishments are mentioned, but no particular data are provided. Furthermore, the absence of completion time makes it impossible to forecast and assess the project's performance. Although varied, the accompanying videos on YouTube are still too short and not compelling enough to gain additional viewers. This will make it difficult to advertise and utilize as a support tool for a large number of individuals. Lastly, the content on the website should be added in theory to make it easier for consumers to follow.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal effectively addresses the challenge. The proposal addresses a challenge, the unavailability of Blockchain learning resources in the French language, that needs to be solved. By making such resources available it will expand the territories of the Cardano community. The proposer also identifies problems that might hinder the goal and addresses them.
f6_assessments.q1:
Given the experience and plan presented, it seems the proposer is a bit overly optimistic. I would like to know the procedure he is going to put in place in getting over 300 developers from just a telegram channel(not that even non developers can join the page for the sake of joining). Furthermore, I’m unable to access the telegram link provided, if that could be worked on.
Also, proposer notes that five members are to work on this proposal, however he provides the names of only four of them.
On a brighter side, the proposer presents a well broken down budget and a detailed timeline
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided is quite sufficient to audit the progress and success of the proposal. The proposer provides evidence of already existing resources available to track these progress.

f6_assessments.q0:
I like the fact of creating content in different languages, however I always wonder what happens if the content grow short and the developer, which were learning from the French material, needs to go to the English one… 
However, creating the first contact and breaking this first barrier might make the curiosity and will to start learning by themselves.

I’ve seen two other risks here: 1) Advertisement: If the marketing isn’t that efficient, maybe the online meetings or the YT videos will have little visibility; and 2) ADA specialist: you’ve said that you’re going to invite specialists to joying the online meetings to teach. Are you already in touch with them?

Besides that, there are some other projects here in catalyst which are aiming to add some blockchain content in French. Maybe reach out them and star working together, the idea here is to impact as many people as possible, creating good content and sharing it.
f6_assessments.q1:
You’ve said ‘For the organization of our online meetups, we will invite experienced developers who have advanced knowledge in Blockchain[…]’. Therefore the proposal would gain if it tackle these points:
1)	Do you already have this specialist? If not, it rises the next questions
2)	The value associated to the ‘trainer’ might change a lot, adding the fact that  you’ve not specified the time in which he will need to dedicate (how long the classes are going to be, who is going to write the content, etc).
3)	If he is the specialist, shouldn’t he create the table of content?

Another aspect that I would like to see more broken down is the budget. You’ve written the cost in a general manner, however having this in smaller bits would be better. 

Other point is that you intend to have 16 Saturdays in 4 months, however I’ve seen only 7 subjects. What are the plan to the others. Another aspect is adding the duration.

At last but not least is the fact that you did not added a method to become sustainable. Since you’re asking for funding and need to pay the specialist, e.g., how are you going to keep this project after the fund finish.  It would be nice to have a continuation of these meetings, as you said, however you need to think about soma way to make money. Maybe starting to or incentivize the students to create some NFT and start to sell it.
f6_assessments.q2: The overall auditability is quite good. It might enrich the proposal if you add some other KPI such as # of YT views, # of downloads (from the site), # of Q&A (maybe create a forum to incentivize the participation).

f6_assessments.q0:
Providing access about the Cardano ecosystem and the blockchain in various languages to people, allow these to identify themselves to the shared info, and adopt it.
French is one the languages spoken in so many countries in Africa, being myself originally from an African French country, I know  how important news or information may be welcomed by French speakers.
As a proposal that intent to create a Cardano French Community In DR Congo, it aligns with growing the presence and adoption of Cardano in that country. 
The proposal plans in organizing regular meetup to discuss about the blockchain, focused on the DR Congo, with a scalability possibility to other French speaking countries.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal team is formed by three people who claim to be familiar with the blockchain and have expertise in App & software development and software, which can be an asset for the success. It would be interesting to see more about various in which the founders were or are involved around the Catalyst project /Cardano ecosystem and the blockchain to reinforce what it's stated about the founders expertise.
The project is plan to last 4 months with 16 sessions in total. This summarizes the timeframe of it. The source of the content to share during the meeting up sessions is already identified.
What I would be curious to see would be more details about the budget, on top of the budget sections/lines shared  by the proposals in the current version.
f6_assessments.q2:
The results of this project would be the videos  produced and used during the meetups that will be posted online. This will allow the community to follow and audit.
Number of participants to meetups, number of meetups hosted, integration of blockchain information learned by developers into an application. They are some of the key indicators of success.
Not much was said about the risks and challenges, but by being familiar with the African continent, I can point out the challenge of lack of infrastructure, like the Internet connection,, electricity... Wouldn't be also an idea to stream those videos on Youtube ? This would facilitate more people to access them since Facebook videos are more reachable than Youtube videos because of connection speed.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem described here is a good fit into the challenge. Raising Congolese developers who will be able to contribute to the integration of Cardano blockchain in application is a goal that aligns with the challenge of seeding and growing Africa and when executed creates a big positive mark for the ecosystem. The proposal can reach out to more and more developers in the long run sense.
The proposal effectively addressed the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: I can say that the information about the team and their relevant experience and expertise gives me the assurance that they are up to the task. However I have an issue with the budget, I was expecting that a more breakdown of the items under each of the two steps ($3000 for step 1 and $6000 for step 2) given so that the amount could be subject to the last level of scrutiny so that we can determine to the later how the funds would be disbursed. However, I believe it’s still reasonable to achieve the set goals. The plan presented here is concise and the timeline is also definite. The risks/challenges have been considered, and for me is a good effort required in auditing a proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap is concise with milestones/deliverables and time horizon for the achievement of the project. One desired outcome of the proposal is to reach out to African developers from French speaking countries interested in blockchain technology is a good indicator of what success looks like. The metrics/KPIs chosen are good indicators of evaluating success as they are concerned with measuring the number of session attendees amongst others

solution: Organize weekly live code meetups on Blockchain technology to expand the French community in order to broaden our knowledge on the subject.
experience: Startup working in the development of Web, Mobile, and Desktop applications; with more than 18 developers, with a community of more than 100 developers(telegram channel).
